Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Fanatical \Fa*nat"ic*al\, a. Characteristic of, or relating to, fanaticism; fanatic. -{Fa*nat"ic*al*ly}, adv. -- {Fa*nat"ic*al*ness}, n. [1913 Webster]
fanatical adj : marked by excessive enthusiasm for and intense devotion to a cause or idea; "rabid isolationist" [syn: {fanatic}, {overzealous}, {rabid}]
